ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My Hebrew improved significantly! I feel much more confident in my speaking abilities about taking this class.
Great class. Orit is very organized and thoughtful with how she structured the class. I think my hebrew definitely reached a new level of fluency this semester.
Improved listening, speaking, writing, and reading skills in Hebrew.

This course is a continuation of L3, so it continues to teach the future tense and more word forms. In addition, you continue to practice and grow skills in reading, writing, listening, speaking, and general comprehension.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: lots of different opportunities for practice in the target language. Weakness: repetitive at times, and too much focus on grammar.

Strengths: Many opportunities for practicing Hebrew, both in class and outside of class, every class is different, there is a lot of variety to keep the class engaging. 

Weaknesses: Some of the work can feel repetitive and not very effective or useful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely! I looked forward to it each day.
If you are interested in learning Hebrew and improving your skills in the language, then yes.

Yes! This is a fantastic course. Orit is incredible. My Hebrew abilities have skyrocketed since taking this course. This class is very good at facilitating a more consistent use of Hebrew that results in more practice and thus productivity and success.
